metadata.title: CVE-2021-31808 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Squid before 4.15 and 5.x before 5.0.6. Due toan input-validation bug, it is vulnerable to a Denial of Service attack(against all clients using the proxy). A client sends an HTTP Range requestto trigger this.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-31808` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 4.10-1ubuntu1.4
squid-cgi - 4.10-1ubuntu1.4
squid-common - 4.10-1ubuntu1.4
squid-purge - 4.10-1ubuntu1.4
squidclient - 4.10-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.10-1ubuntu1.4').
